text: Tap at Nisa in Kaunas. A tropical fruit bomb, sweet, fruity, ester-ish a bit, no bitterness, quite full, nice smooth texture. Golden hazy body, nice head.

Aroma of tropical fruit and sweet malt. 

It pours bright golden, super hazy with a dense frothy head. 

Taste of fruits; mango, pineapple and light grapefruit. Bitterness is subtle grapefruit towards the finish. 

Its real juicy and smooth.
Świetnie tropikalne aromaciki, troche granulatu chmielowego, w smaku lekko kwaskowe, czuć fajna pełnośc sokowa, goryczka delikatna, bdb ponad polroczna ipa!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z Untappd w ramach uzupełnienia profilu. Chyba lepszej IPA ze starego kontynentu nie piłem.

Bottle received in a trade with Thomas, cheers! Pours cloudy pale yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma of hops, malt, citrus and tropical fruit. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness. Medium body, slight oily texture, average to soft carbonation. Finish is bitter, fruity and dry. Very nice!
Bottle at work. Pours hazy yellow, nose is grapefruit, peach, biscuity, taste is sweet, fruity, dry.

6.5%ABV. IPA.

Poured out cloudy gold. 6SRM.

Nose has citrus and fresh baked bread malty aroma.

Mouthfeel is juicy and well-carbonated. Palate has pale malt with biscuits and crackers. Hops are grapefruit peel, lemon zest, pine with a slightly sappy finish.

Finish is medium with a nice lingering bitter.

Goes on Favorites List!

Overall, one of my favorite beers of all time. Well-balanced palate, good full-bodied mouthfeel, juicy without being silly, flavorful without being cloying. Absolutely wonderful.

hazy, very pale yellow colour; aroma of intensive tropical fruits, mainly mango, passionfruit and pineapple, lemony and grapefruit notes, as well as some overripe, almost rotten peach; prefectly balaced bittersweetness with pineapple, mango, overripe peach, grapefruit and biscuit notes; amazing IPA!

Batch 584, best before 16/07/17, aperta il 7 aprile 2017.
Color pompelmo rosa, molto molto velata, schiuma bianca fine e di ottima persistenza.
Aroma prevalente di passion fruit, mango, ananas, buccia di cocomero e durian, pepe, erbacea, non troppo resinosa.
Al palato passion fruit, ananas, durian, pepe; finale marcatamente erbaceo e pepato accompagnato da passion fruit, piccante con lievi note di ananas e durian, tutto molto persistente.
Retrolfatto erbaceo con buccia di cocomero in primo piano, pepato.
Ben carbonata, corpo medio-leggero, amaro estremamente persistente.

A bottle from a bottleshare
Lovely fruitiness. Simply said its a juicy IPA with the accent on the juicy part. This is a beer I could drink all day long. Great!
The best part about this beer is that its very full and fruity at the same time. Probably one of the best IPAs I have had. Ever.
Thanks Peter A. This is a blast of hops you have sent me! Absolutely love it!

From bottle and from tap at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Hazy yellow color with white head. Hoppy and light malty aroma, grassy, citrusy fruity, orange, grapefruit, tropical fruits, floral notes. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Great IPA. Don't think it fully lived up to its reputation though. Probably because of the batch date. Color is hazy orange. Flavour is slightly bitter with a full after taste of orange, peach and lime. Bottle bought at Beergium.com.

On tap, @BierCab, Barcelona. 25/03/17
Color amarillo turbio, aromas citricos seguidos de notas frutales, el sabor es frutal con notas tropicales y cuerpo medio.
Pours cloudy yellow, low head. Very citrusy, tropical, grains, mango, resin, mosaic? Very nice bitterness, citrus fresh taste. Medium body, average carbonation. Really good.

330ml bottle from BrewDog Online. Pours cloudy yellow with a huge frothy white head, retention and lacing are good. Strong hoppy aroma of tropical fruit and citrus, grapefruit, mango. Taste of juicy tropical and citrus fruits, grapefruit, pine, moderate bitterness. Medium body, nice mouthfeel. Pretty awesome IPA this.

33cl bottle. Hazy straw color. Thin white head. Aroma is hops, tangerine, pine. Taste is medium bitter. Body is medium and quite dry. Flavour is orange zest, hops, resin, grapefruit, blueberries, white grapes, catpiss.
Bottle at tasting. Hazy golden pour. Aroma of veggies, pineapple, citrus and mango. Flavor has soft mango, citrus, veggies, pineapple, grassy nettle and subtle pine. Good stuff.

Really lively fruity nose. Tropicals, sweet oranges, some rubbery doughy notes, wheaty blandness, citrus currant leaves. Med bodied juicy, fruity, smooth, easy, really nice drinkability. Good sweetness, like a good marmelade without being sugary. Kinda nice balance, vibrant lively juicy. Quite alright. I could do without the citra-currantleafy- kick in the finish, otherwise fine.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle BD Edinburgh. This is as good as IPA gets. Massive floral, caramel, hop, mango aroma. Soft taste, with so much going on. Funk, cheese, toffee, pine, mango, popcorn, thyme, and the rest. So good.
0,4l on tap @ Sori Taproom. Pours hazy golden with a medium creamy head. Aroma is malts with tropical fruits. Flavor is fruity malts with a hoppy finish. If it only were fresh. Still decent.

At a tasting, thanks, small bubbly head, cloudy murky yellow color with orange taints,piney herbal aroma with some citrus behind and a hint of onion, fruity soapy flavor with a hint of onion, light mellow sweetness, mellow herbal soapy bitterness. Nice.

Tap at Sori Taproom, Helsinki. Colour is very cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, tropical fruits, mango, some hops and malts. Very juicy but this one needs hops. Little bit of musty too. Totally overrated beer.

Bottle. Pours pale golden. Nice fresh hoppy aroma. Tropical fruit, passionfruit, orange, grapefruit, pine. Very juicy. Medium body. Balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Fruity hoppy. Aroma of citrus, tropical, grapefruit and floral. Fresh and fruity. Lots of hops but only light medium bitter. Light and juicy. A great one! Hop juice...

Bottle. It pours very hazy golden with a creamy white head. Loads of tropical fruity aroma notes. Gooseberry, passion fruit and pineapple. Floral and crisp. Crisp fruity hoppy flavor. Tropical fruity and floral notes. Pomelo and red grapefruit. Amazing drinkability.

Gyönyörű, repcemézhez hasonlatos, ananászlé-szerű főzet hófehér habbal, mely szédítő intenzitással ontja magából a trópusi aromákat. A vehemens, tényleg kirobbanóan üde illatok mangóhúsos, grapefruitos, szegfűszáras, lime-os jégkásás színben villódznak, s talán csak a kinézete által, mégis van benne valami krémes, shake-es hangulat is. Szerkezete kezdetben kissé éles, közepesen szénsavas, idővel azonban kedvemre való módon csitul, így lesz szinte tökéletes. Ízletes komlóbomba, néhol mézédesnek ható gyümölcsös jegyekkel, amiket remekül egyensúlyoznak a tartalmas, grapefruitos kesernyével játszadozó markáns árnyalatok. Összességében azonban mégis a trópusi hangulatok körül forog a karakter, minden elem ennek szolgálatába van állítva, egy rendkívül könnyen iható, mégis átlagon felüli tartalommal felruházott főzet benyomását keltve. Nem én vagyok a legnagyobb IPA-fan a világon, viszont az ilyen italokat bármikor szívesen fogadom, csodálatos főzet.

Amazingly hazy pale golden color, like on the verge of looking like a Wit beer. Ive never seen a NE IPA this pale. Very soft hops in the nose but so well defined with stone fruit and white grapefruit. So well rounded in the nose. The body is so well integrated, so smooth and definitely an amazing take on a NE IPA. Modest bitter finish. Yum

Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom Ls place. Thanks Vova. Cloudy yellow with aq white head. Nice hoppy aroma, fruity, tropical, citric, "green", oniony. Dry flavor, bitterish, with fruity and "green" hops. Light to medium-bodied. Good.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2017 Batch 576? Pours straw like golden color, cloudy with foamy stable white head with good lacing. Aroma: intense hop notes, which takes on tropical fruits, dank, citruses, some floral notes....flavor: biscuit like malt notes, supported with hops. Hop bitterness is medium, finish is slightly dry and gentle fruity bitter. Body is moderate, texture almost creamy, carbonation moderate.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 Bottle. Lovely bright cloudy straw with a great white head. Rich aroma of tropical fruit, pineapple, citrus, vanilla, nuts and pine. Refreshing well balanced hop-centric taste (a bit sweetish), the bitterness is well rounded. Light to medium body, frothy texture. Awesome, one of my favorite IPAs.
Cytrusy, marakuja, ananas. Goryczka krótka, wyraźna, ale nie zalega, bardzo przyjemna. Ogólne odczucie bardzo lekkie, świeże, cytrusowe, wyjątkowo dobre.
Sampled from bottle at THT March at Kwartje. Hazy yellow with white head. Sweet malts, exotic fruity, kumquat, milky, oaty. Medium sweet and light bitter. Medium body and soft carbonation.

Bottle shared at the March THT. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a white head. Nice lemony, tropical, peach, pineapple, dank, weed, grapefruit. Nice balance. Medium sweet, over medium bitter. Medium body, low carbonation.
Bottle shared at THT. Very hazy with a white head. Aroma of floral notes, citrus and light caramel malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared at THT. Hazy pale straw with white head. Dank weedy hops with marijuana and pineapple. Theres also some mango, light yeast, grapefruit candy, cheese, lemon drops. Medium sweet and bitter. Just medium bodied.

Pours hazy yellow with medium white sticky head. Aroma: pine, oranges, tropical fruits, resin, ripe pear, grass. Taste: sweetish, smooth bitter, juicy. Medium body. Not so bitter as I expect. Bitter finish. Nice.
Bottle @ Gollem. Cloudy orange yellow, big head. Big creamy pine hop aroma. Woody biscuit grapefruit hop flavour. Smooth mango aftertaste. See why this is a top 50 IPA

Średnio i drobno oczkowa piana, nietrwała. Barwa żółta, mętna jak sok. W aromacie cytrusy, głównie pomarańcze i zest z cytryny w towarzystwie mango i ananasa, średnio intensywnie. W smaku o niebo lepiej - bardzo soczyście, owocowo, cytrusowo, lekka owocowa słodkość i kwaskowość, całkiem solidna ale krótka grejpfrutowa goryczka i cierpkość na finiszu. Niskie do średniego drobne wysycenie, mega orzeźwiające w odbiorze.

No to chyba mamy zwycięzcę w kategorii NEIPA, które czaruje głównie w smaku - w kategorii piwa codziennego na równi choćby z takimi tuzami jak Focal Banger, Pacific czy Wheat is the New Hops...

Bottle. Hazy yellow beer with firm white head, good lacing. Rich, intense, hoppy aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, pineapple, mango, lemon, orange, mild pine. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter, juicy, fruity (pineapple, orange, tangerine, grapefruit), with very pleasant, short bitterness in the finish. Medium body and carbonation, quite creamy texture. Magnificent, outstanding, extremely drinkable NE IPA! I could drink this every day.
Bottle at Gollem recommended by Philip, thanks! Hazy golden yellow color white ice cream cone head. Nice earthy pineapple aroma. Taste is bittersweet tropical fruit and citrus. Delicious.

Draught. Unclear yellow in color with a white head. Notes of citrus fruits, tropical ripe fruity vibes and some grassyness in aroma. Feels quite fresh and lemony juicy at the same time. Nice. Citrus in taste, also some grapefruity bitterness and later on even hints of tropical fruity sweetness. Some soft malty notes, bit of peaches and bitterness again in the end. Really juicy and tasty one with good drinkability.

Cloudy pale looks with a nice head. Tropical and grapefruit to the nose. Grapefruit and lychee fight it off before citrus bitterness and a ever slight acid kick.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

from Au Trappiste - cloudy lactic-orange beer with a white foam left; very strong aroma of grapefruit and tangerines; full-bodied, lively and very tasty palate; fairly bitter and dry; some sourness in a long and clean assertive grapefruity and orange finish - great !
Nice IPA, but nothing really blowing out of the water. Nice, fruity aroma and taste, not very sweet, very drinkable.

A 330ml bottle, batch 573, with a best before date of 30th June 2017. Poured into a Lost Abbey teku glass. It was a hazy golden straw yellow colour with a two finger white head that had pretty good retention and left nice lacing. Aromas were of sweet tropical and citrus fruits. So juicy, full of mango, apricot, pineapple, grapefruit rind, lemon peel and a touch of pine. Tastes of sweet and juicy fruits to begin. Passion fruit, pineapple and grapefruit zest with hints of orange and mango. Light to moderate lasting hop bitterness on the finish. Light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, wow this was the best IPA Ive had in the last few months. Extremely juicy and extremely drinkable. I could easily crush a few bottles of this. Ive heard that this is close to the last batch that they will produce, which if true, is definitely a disappointment. This IPA is a must buy and try in my book if you can still find it.

Pours whitish yellow, hazy and actually with a nicely decent foam. Fresh juicy aroma, totally fruity, pineapple, papaya, passion fruit and a bit of mango. Bitterness is down there but its a smoothie, with some hop juice. Taste has decent bitterness but more juice than you can imagine, really balanced and supremely drinkable. Leaving strong hop tingle in the finish, harsh and green but thats kind of what you really want.

kindly shared by impuritylaw, thanks a lot! lots of pine resin and dankness/passionfruit pulp, papaya and papaya seeds, and noble rot on white grapes. Great passionfruit hoppiness with that side-effect of resinous and grassy hop-pellet-taste and mouthfeel with a somewhat numbing finish.
Very nice IPA, if blasted all out of proportion. Has some fruityness, moderate bitterness and decent mouthfeel and aftertaste.

330 ml bottle.
Big and luscious on the aroma with with a lot of tropical fruit and flowery hops. Taste is citrus, mango and even some peach. Backed up by a malt sweetness thats balanced well with the bitterness and frutiness from the hops. Mouthfeel is full and juicy and it tastes fresh and lively. Incredible beer.
Bottle. Amber colour with white head. Tropical fruits and citric aroma. Sweet, tropical fruits, juice and citric taste. Medium body.

Appearance is very light for an IPA, almost straw-coloured. Some head, very hazy. Aroma is amazing, so fruity! I especially smell citrus fruits - grapefruit and lemon are pronounced. So refreshing too. Mouthfeel is light and fruity. Flavour: light to medium body but so many flavours, really complex fruity profile. Somehow this IPA has a really special feel to it, I especially find the pronounced lemon flavour exceptional. Finishes fruity and light but also a bit herbal and warm. Wow. What an Amazing beer.

On tap at Koht, Tallinn. Hazy yellow to orange with a lasting, white head. Very fruity aroma, lots of tropical fruits, some citrus and light piney and herbal notes. Moderate sweet with surprisingly balanced fruity and hoppy flavours and a fine bitterness. Excellent drinkability and quite delicious.

On tap at the Hoppy Pub. Pours hazy yellow with a white bubbly head. Full aroma of hops, fruits, citrus, mango, pine. Light body and so enjoyable with perfect carbonation. Taste is like fresh juice of grapefruit, peach, citrus and hops...
Sooo gooood !

0.33 l bottle from Beergium, best before June 2017, batch 57S. Milky, straw yellow with a thin, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, very fruity and slightly grassy aroma of mango, passion fruit, pineapple and some lemon peel. Sweetish, slightly bitter, very juicy-fruity and slightly grassy taste of mango, passion fruit, pineapple, some lemon peel and a touch of sweet banana, followed by a rather long, quite dry-bitter, slightly grassy and a bit resiny finish. Medium to full body, smooth, almost milky and just slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Really tasty stuff, drinks almost like a mango smoothie. Great mouthfeel, lots of juicy fruits, very well-balanced.

Aromat to głównie owoce, mango, cytrusy, trochę marakui. Smak lekko gorzki, sporo ciała, gładkie, goryczka krótka i przyjemna. W smaku cytrusy i mango. Świetne piwo. Miło że w Europie powstają NEIPA na poziomie tych z US.
Med en underbar doft och smak så är detta en av dom bättre ölen som jag har druckit.

330ml bottle. Pours light hazy pale yellow, medium sized bright white bubbly head, lacing. Aroma is juicy, citrussy, fresh tropical fruits, lime peel. Taste is juicy, citrussy, bittersweet, grapefruity. Lots of citrussy notes, lemon peel, orange juice. Perfectly balanced and extremely well drinkable. Light bodied, perfectly carbonated. Very nice IPA!

Bottled 330ml (Beergium, batch 57S, BB 06/2017)
Murky yellow color, medium-sized white head and lace. Fruity aroma has citrus, mango and grapefruit. Medium-bodied. Tropical fruity flavor: citrus, pineapple, grapefruit. Very fruity, soft and mellow, not so much IBU backend. Dangerously drinkable. One of my first encounters with NE IPA.

Tap at Koht, Tallinn
Cloudy yellow. Aroma is fruity: sharp acidic fruts: white grape, lychee, and maybe a hint of kiwi. Phil gets a touch of rubber from the malts.Mellow, fruity,hoppy body. The pale malts soften the body and maybe adda hint of starch near the bottom. Perfectly drinkable. Phil didnt even sneer at it. :)

Tap. Cloudy orange color. Small size, white head, stays. Fruity, grapefruit, oranges, citrus in aroma. Kind of like mix of oranges, red and white grapefruit juice and some syrup. Fuck me, but this is highly drinkable. Pleasant balance. Excellent brew.

Tap shared by Marduk, thanks! Hazy yellow beer, small white head. Nose is sweet, malts, hops, citric notes. Flavor is malts with toasty notes, citrus, fruit. Finish is slightly dry, hop, lemon peel, mild dryness. Very drinkable.

330ml bottle. Slightly hazy pale yellow colour. Medium white head. Extremely fruity and refreshing aroma. Slight notes of some berries even. Really hard to describe which kind of fruits are present. Soliva is ready to come before I had a first zip. Extremely fruity, grapfruity, juicy beginning. Lots of pineapples, grapefruits, tangerines, oranges in the middle. Extremely fruity finish. Nice grapefruity, bitter, fruity aftertaste. The bitterness does not come from the hops, but it really is coming from like real citrusses. Light bodied, really well drinkable, juicy brew. Phenomenal!

(Stigbergets Gbg Beer Week 2016) Bottle 330ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 6.5%
Bright sunny yellow colour on the body, very hazy, with a finger of thick, white head on top, pretty good retention. 
Great aroma, lots of citrus, grapefruit, fresh cut grass, lemon flowers, lemon leaves.
Taste follows, very citrucy, grapefruit, but also some tropical fruits now.
Medium body with biting carbobation.
Very good and highly drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2017 (Re-rate, keg at Sori Taproom, 20170306) Aftertaste was more balanced than in the bottled one and the herbalness was missing. 

(Bottle, 0.33 l - batch 558 -  BB 280517, thanks Hermod,  20170215) The beer poured golden and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, pine, herbalness and citricness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, citricness, white bread, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy and bitter. A pleasant hoppy brew. Old rating: 3.7

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Bottle, BB 16.07.17 (thanks BlazerT). Pours hazy yellow with huge whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is hoppy, fruits, citrus, mango, passionfruit. Flavor is sweet and bitter, intense citrus, grapefruit, mango, tangerines, sugar, some popcorn. Finish is intense grapefruit bitter with some alcohol. Overall: very good, but not as refined as I expected. It feels that the amount of hops in this one is insane, but I would like it to be less sweet, less boozy, etc. It almost seems like the hops are covering up for a recipe thats actually not that good. Yet as I said: its really really hoppy and I really like hops...

More juicy, a lot more mellow. Not really as hoppy as the bottle, no tingling hops, but does have less booze also. Still too sweet, I prefer bottle (tap would be ~3.5)

Bottle. Hazy yellow, great head. Aroma mainly of pineapple, white tropical fruits (litchee), some oranges underneath, very fresh and fruity. In taste fruity, lots of tropical fruits, very juicy. Medium body with creamy texture, moderate carbonation and bitter finish. Great brew.

Do szkła nalewamy jasno złoty i błotniście mętny płyn, z ładną biała i umiarkowanie trwałą pianą. 
Aromat jest zdominowany chmielem w postaci mieszanki owoców tropikalnych i cytrusów, do tego wyraźnie czuć nuty tytoniowo-trawiaste przypominające świeży pelet chmielowy. Po ogrzaniu z tyłu wychodzi delikatny zapach cebuli, ale prawdopodobnie jest to wynik mocnego chmielenia. 
W smaku piwo jest niezwykle soczyste i owocowe, ale co najważniejsze nie w sztuczny, soczkowy sposób. Pojawia się delikatna słodycz białego pieczywa, i gładkość musu owocowego, która towarzyszy nam do końca picia piwa. Pojawiają się posmaki owoców tropikalnych i grejpfrutów z pomarańczami. Goryczka jest średnio-wysoka, na krótko zalegająca, ale bardzo przyjemna.

Piwo pojawiło się w 2016 roku i od razu narobiło zamieszania w rejtach.
Kolor, jak widać mętne (New England?), ładna gęsta piana i obłędny aromat! Tak, aromat to po prostu bomba owocowa! Ananas, grapefruit, brzoskwinie. Do tego dochodzą aromaty iglaste. Tekstura gęsta, to piwo wręcz można jeść łyżką! W smaku tak jak w aromacie: owoce tropikalne, sosna i delikatna goryczka. Jeden łyk i jeb nie ma połowy! Cóż za pijalność! O takie IPY nic nie robiłem!

Backlog. Great fruit aroma, pinapple, mango, after heating also hoppy scents. Hazy prang with rocky white head. Tasteing great ! A lot of fruits. Medium body, reminding juice, soft carbonation, with low bitternes in finish
Good and over rated IPA. Smells and tastes like grapefuit. Citrus flavour. Excellent finish. Not bad!

Bottle. 
Hazy bright golden pour, small head. 
Nose really fresh and hoppy, taste the same, with a long bitter finish. 
Awesome, best IPA so far this year. 
Medium body, soft carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2017 Best IPA in the world? Probably, its fruity, tropical and amazingly juicy both in aroma and taste that I could drink it forever. If I could drink only one beer to the rest of my life I would pick this one.
Really nice and juicy colour. Nice nose with hops and fruit. Very dry taste.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a GBG Beer Week IPA 2016 by Stigbergets Bryggeri at Muzeum Azji i PacyfikuMega rzeskie, owocowe, leciutkie, soczkowate, takie akurat.mozna pic wiadrami, mozna sie w tym kąpać. Klasa. Ananasa czuje poza wszystkim!!!Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bought like 20 bottles and couldnt be happier about it. 
Aroma to die for. Literally didnt want to start drinking for like 10 minutes. 
Very refreshing. Best IPA so far.

Draught. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Greenish yellow colour. Light malty and heavy bitter flavor. Strong grape notes. MOderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Too much grape. Unharminic. Creamy palate.

Bottle, and also a growler fill, from Little Leeds Beer House. Super hazy, dark yellow. Thin, sticky, white head. Nose has vanilla malts. Lemon and orange milkshake. Hint of sappy pine. Its not overly complex, but its pretty mouthwatering. Taste is sorbet sweet, with a light, citrus fruit bitterness. Mouthfeel is clean, foamy and juicy. Finishes light, juicy, citrusy bitter. Lovely.

Aroma of citrus, resin and slight floral. Appearance of slight murk and great head retention, soft to medium carbonation.
Taste of citrus, pine, sweet savoury finish. balanced, no real alcohol. Incredibly drinkable.
Bottle. Low fluffy white quickly disappearing head. Hazy milky yellow body. Mild fruity aroma and flavor with a nice hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long bitter finish.
Prezentuje się świetnie. Piana drobna, dość trwała. Aromaty mega świeżych cytrusów. W smaku jest jeszcze lepiej. Cytrusy i świetna pijalność. Świetne piwo.
Bottle @ Bibere, Piraeus. Color unclear yellow with medium white head. Aroma hoppy, lemon, malt, peach, grapefruit. Taste sweet, hoppy, lemon, peach, bitter.
33cl bottle. Cloudy pale golden with a big white head. Grapefruit, passion fruit, mango, melon, pine and yeast. Very good!!

Finally got my hands on the (unfortunately) last batch of this famous brew. 
Thin stripe of white head. 
The colour is amazing though, super hazy, almost lemonady. 
Aroma is fresh & citrus and tropical fruits along with a very clear smell of peach & vanilla. Stunning. 
Taste follows the aroma spot on, with a hint of that lovely peach/vanilla from the aroma that I was hoping for. Pineapple & passionfruit hits the top of the palate. Perfumey and floral at the end.
Not sticky but perfect thickness for an IPA. 
Overall, this actually lived up to the hype. Wow. 
Two things this beer didnt deliver though; bitterness and stickiness. 
Imagine a more bitter and dank Double IPA version of this. One can only dream. I hold the Westcoast IPA a bit higher than this though!
W pełni rozumiem hype. Niezwykle owocowe, aromatyczne, kremowe, cudnie pijalne IPA z genialnym owocowym smakiem. Prawie jak Tree Gouse Green. Wielkie piwo, wielka przyszłość przed Stigbergets!

Warka:  567 
 Data ważności:  19.06.2017 
 Kolor:  Żółte. Mętne jak cholera. Gęste jak kisiel. 
 Piana: Doskonała, puszysta, wysoka, obfita.
Biała warstwa drobnych i średnich pęcherzyków powietrza przez długi czas wisi nad piwem. Piana stacza się w dół do grubej otoczki.
Na krawędziach szkła można zaobserwować rzeszę pajęczych sieci.
Rewelka! 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest kosmiczny! Świeży, rześki, obłędnie intensywny owocowy aromat. Dominują owoce cytrusowe wsparte o minimalną bazę w postaci tropików. W nosie czuć świeżo zerwane z drzewa mandarynki, ananasy, pomarańcze, limonki, czy grejpfruty. 
Na drugim końcu tylko kapka marakui i mango.
Na równoległej płaszczyźnie zabójcza porcja nut leśnych, żywicznych, iglastych.
Cały las ociekający żywicą. 
 Edited:  Po kilku godzinach od degustacji puste szkło ciągle pachnie jakby przed sekundą zostało opróżnione. 
 Smak:  G E N I A L N Y!
Świeży, soczysty, intensywny owocowy smak.
Dominują owoce cytrusowe.
Tony mandarynek, setki kilogramów limonek, grejpfrutów, ananasów i pomarańczy.
Tylko delikatny posmak marakui i mango.
Poza owocami mamy równie przyjemne nuty iglaste, leśne, sosnowe i modrzewiowe. Świeża, lepka żywica skapującą z drzew. 
W oddali pałęta się kapka ziół. Piwo jest do bólu wytrawne z odrobinę pikantnym finiszem.
Goryczka jest dokładnie w punk. Nie jest ani za krótka, ani za wysoka. Znika jeszcze przed kolejnym łykiem.
Pozostawia krótkotrwały wytrawny, grejpfrutowy posmak w ustach. Tekstura piwa jest półpełna, nagazowanie średnie.
Jeśli miałbym określić pijalność trunku od 1 do 10, z całą pewnością zabrakłoby mi skali. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Byłem w USA wiele razy. Piłem świeże IPA od najlepszych amerykańskich browarów.
Muszę przyznać jednak, że GBG Beer Week przebija chyba je wszystkie.

Piwo pachnie obłędnie. Jak walizka wypełniona do pełna studolarowymi banknotami.
Wygląda zabójczo, a na języku i podniebieniu rozchodzi się gładko.
Znika ze szkła w kilka sekund.
Takie piwa mógłbym pić rano, w południe i wieczorem i tak bez końca..

Bottle. Pours hazy pale yellow. Aroma is strong tropical fruit, mango, passion fruit, litchi, a fruit salad would be envious. Body is thick and juicy and chewy, with a smooth carbonation, pleasantly sweet without being overpowered. Sweet palate too, but really nice to drink. An impressive NE IPA.

Aroma: lemon nose, bilberry, blackcurrant aftertaste ; Appearance: Pale cloudy yellow, white medium head (not persistent) ; Taste: medium bitterness, low sweetness ; Palate: medium body, slightly creamy (milky ?), average carbonation. Overall a good beer, but not a 100% one imo.

Bottled. Hazy yellow coloures. Dense off white head. Aroma. 
 Herbs flowers sweetness spice. Flavour. Fruits. Trop fruits herbs and then some. Med to full bodied, Ends flowery bitter. Great

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2017 Bottle from SB. Hazy light yellow with a big white head that dissapears quickly. Lots of tropical fruit in the aroma, passionfruit, mango, pineapple, orange and some grapefruit and pine. Taste is verry juicy and also dominated by tropical fruits. Got passionfruit and pineapple as the most dominating notes, but also some mango, citrus and pine. Finish is slightly bitter. Great one!

0,33l bottle at home courtesy of Saeglopur, big thanks. BB 13.06.2017. light yellow rather cloudy color, medium big white head. smells grapefruit, citric, light berry notes, passion fruit, some mango, lots of more exotic fruits. lovely smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes grassy, bitter herbal, bit citric, grapefruit, grapefruit zest, mango, lemon grass, lychee, bit leathery. finishes medium bitter with notes of grapefruit zest, lemon grass and some lightly leathery notes. quite lovely one, more on the bitter side of things, but none the less very lovely balance, great and very refreshing grapefruit notes. overall very lovely beer.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2017 (Bottle)Aroma: melon juice,pineapple,leeche, citrus fruits,piney,peach,slightly spicy.Appearance:yellow color,ultra hazy,big dense white head.Taste:dry,flavour of citrus fruits, melon juice,pine and tropic fruits, juicy melon-like finish,bitter citrusy aftertaste.Palate:medium body , thick chewy body, medium carbonation.Overall:Lovely hop juice, I want more!
Very good ipa, probebly the best swedish ipa I ever had. In my point of view it lacks som bitterness.

Keg Half Pint at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey, London in Nov 2016 - Cloudy Yellow in colour. Small off-white head. Good lacing. Very very Fruity; juicy fruits, grapefruit citrus, peel, pith, tropical fruits, peach, mango. Spicy; mildly peppery. Hoppy; piney resinous hops, dank hops. Malty; bready malts. Bitter grapefruit citrus and tropical fruity piney hoppy throughout. Very drinkable. Enjoyed this a lot. Terrific IPA! (2016-11-26)
SImply just the best beer ever known to mankind... nuthin moore nuthin less.
Pours a hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is big with lots of citrus. Juicy! Flavour is bitter with plenty of citrus hops and a little pine. Solid IPA.
Bottle. Light hazy yellow with small white head. Melon, citrus, salty nose. Citrus, herbs, mixed hops, very bitter with some sulphur. Balanced with medium body, grainy palate with long, hoppy palate.

Bottle from Beergium. Hazy yellow color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, tropical fruits, floral hops, resin, a bit of pine, spices and grass. Wonderful balanced body. Bitter finish with citrus, tropical fruits, floral hops, a bit of pine, resin and grass. Exquisite IPA.
Ljusgul grumlig med vit skum. Doftar och smakar massor med tropisk frukt, speciellt annanas. Bra beska och fyllighet.

Bottle. Hazy pale yellow body with fast disappearing white head. Aroma is tropical fruits citrus floral short its a fruit bomb. Taste is nearly the same but with some malts in the background. Aftertaste is perfectly balanced between hoppy fruity bitterness and malty fruity sweetness. Perfect.

Aroma: Very strong floral hops and sweet fruits. 
Flavour: Very floral bitter with fruity notes and a very dry bitter finish. 
Colour: Cloudy pale yellow with a white head. 
From: Bottle @ FLASK Aarhus Dec. 2016.

Bottle with props to Ben! Pours cloudy lemonade, medium white head, good lacing. Aroma is tropical, pineapple, stonefruit, pine, grapefruit. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, clean and juicy. Light plus body. I am sure it has a bit of age in it, but its still quite nice. Reminds me of trillium.
Hazy golden colour with a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, grapefruit, yeast, spice, citrus and bitterness.

Bottle Batch 565 (BB:13/06/17) Pours hazy yellow with fluffy white head.Amazing aroma of hops, mango and pine. Medium carbonation and body, close to the Trillium range of beers.Juicy mouthfeel full of hops and freshness.Amazingly drinkable IPA for sure. World Class.

Bottle. Sensoric. Hazy, bright orange with three fingers, white, semi-thick head. Good head retention and very good lacing. Moderately malty aroma, hight to moderate pineapple, gooseberries, white grapes notes. Moderate tropical fruits - mango, passion fruit notes. Light to moderate sweet with moderate bitterness, stable with moderate duration. Medium body, moderate and creamy texture, average carbonation, finish is chewy, super silk, juicy, smooth, tropical fruits. Summary: This one is really, really fucking juicy IPA. This is pure New England IPA, the state of the art for this style !!! Podsumowanie: Wybitne New England IPA. Aroma powala. Super owocowe - winogrona, ananas, owoce tropikalne, pijalność na najwyższym poziomie. Najlepsze europejskie IPA jake piłem do tej pory.

33cl bottle from Boxbeers. Batch 558.
The beer pours hazy dark yellow color with a thick white head. 
Wow, huge aroma of citrus and pineapples. Super juicy. 
Juicy pineapple hoppy flavors, citrus, piny notes, fresh hops with a tropical fruity lingering finish. Awesome IPA. The drinkability really is amazing. Could drink litres of this.

330 ml bottle from Beergium, bb 13.06.17
Dark yellow, very hazy body, with a big, creamy, lacing, yellowish head.
Amazingly juicy, crisp aroma of pine needles, lemon juice, apricot, kiwi, passion fruit, pineapple, biscuit.
Tastes pretty similar, very crisp and juicy again, yet pretty easy.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes dry, medium bitter, very crisp again, zesty, citric, medium piney, juicy, a bit yeasty, a bit warming.

Wow! Among the very best IPAs Ive had so far and its not from the US! Perfectly balanced, juicy, with loads of lovely fruits, but also super crisp pine notes, with a perfectly dosed malt body and a pleasant dryness. Characterwise this reminds me a bit of the best ones from the Cloudwater DIPA series, but with a much lower ABV of course and a lot more drinkability. Stunning!

330 ml. bottle @ Gollem. 18 days old. Very hazy orange, collapsing white head. Nose is gorgeous USA hops, white grape & litchi, some grass, lovely rich. Taste is mellow fluffy green grass, litchi, white grape, grass, low mango, amazing hop profile. Really delicate, interesting & huge fruit hop profile, very faint yeast, very rich & heavy for the ABV. Very lovely indeed, tastes like something that Trillium or Hill Farmstead would make (better than quite a few beers from both those guys). Deserves the hype.

Yields a bright citrus pulp yellow color, utterly hazed, with a big, foamy white head.

Smells of a citrussy juiciness, with lots of blood oranges, kiwi, passion fruit and woodruff jello. The citrus is very well pronounced though and maintains a prominent crispness on the nose, which definitely creates a juicy impression, but with a nice, perfumy depth to it. 

Drinks great, silk on the tongue, with a creamy, light mouthfeel and subtle, only slightly sparkly carbonation. Utmost juicy during the beginning, remarkably dry in the finish, with a very pleasant transition in between.

Offers citrus peel from the start, a hint of passion fruit, guave and sugared white bread malts. Focussed on the lemon though, with a sweet mid palate, in which the malts cut easily through. As soon as they came up, the malts vanish and open up the palate to a great citrussy finish. This turns out to be utmost bitter and long lasting, with just enough orange juice to remember the beers intial qualities and to add a nice, bright depth to the dryness.

Awesome twist between New England and West Coast IPA with a very juicy nose. Bitter, bright finish and a welcomed malt sweetness in between. Very versatile for its abv, as well as pungent in all its well working facetts - a treat.
UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 A very fine IPA, well-balanced in aroma of taste. Hazy yellow appearance without much foam. Average carbonation medium-full body. Tasteful and plain.

Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is tropical fruits for days, grain, corn, spices. Taste is corn, malt, some tropical notes, mineral. Amazing texture, very smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Wow!

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2017 33cl bottle at home. Hazy milky golden with a medium-height white head. Tons of tropical fruit in the nose, light lactic acid and citrus. Taste notes include tropical fruit, orange zest, herbal hops, pine resin, dank hops. Medium body, nice mouthfeel. This beer could do with a bit more sweetness, and aside from that I detect a very subtle medicinal bitterness in the aftertaste, but other than that, it is a very solid IPA. 4.2/5

revisited the same batch after a couple of weeks: the astringent bitterness is greatly toned down now,  there are some funky hop notes that I did not notice the first time, and the beer feels sweeter than first time.

Bottle from Malt Attacks. Pours hazy yellow, good white head. Smell is intense, citrussy, crisp, bitter. Very specific on the lemon, actually. taste is very fresh, again lemon, but more than just that. also very malty. Very juicy, yet a rather strong bitterness to it. very nice IPA !

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2016 Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fá in Rome-Italy. Cloudy/juicy apricot skin color, medium and persistent foamy cap. Nose is an aromatic bouquet of tropical fruit, grapefruit and quite oniony. Fantastic. Mouth is by far less aggressive. Charming juicy beer with grapefruit finish.

33 cl bottle. Batch #549. BBE 07.05.2017.
Pours hazy golden color with a small head. Nice lemony aroma, hoppy, slightly herbal, some pineapple notes. Flavor is fruity with pineapple, lemon, some orange, bitterness is decent, fair amount of hops. Very nice and balanced IPA.

Aroma is fruity hops. Citrus, grape fruit, peach. Taste the same. Bitter, creamy. NE-style IPA. Lovely.
33 cl. bottle. Hazy golden colour with a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, grapefruit, yeast, spice, citrus and bitterness.

Tap @ basement beer bar Aalborg. Aroma of tropical fruit hops, grassy, and resin. Hazy light yellow with white head, mostly diminishing. Taste is light bitter and light sweet. Medium+ body, oily thick feel and sweet hoppy finish.

Aroma kicks in the moment you open this beer - pineapple(!), passion fruit, sweet citrus and other tropical fruits. Taste is juicy as fack - not a lot of bitterness but tons of tropical fruit. mmmmmm

(330ml bottles from Systembolaget, various batches, all < 2 weeks old) Pours nearly opaque pale orange with an average, fine white head that fades to a ring with lace. Super fruity aroma is almost pungent, with loads of passion fruit, lychee, peach, mango, tangerine, pear, slight pineapple, floral, a little pine/leafy dank character, maybe a touch of vanilla and oats. Flavour is a bit less utterly fruit driven and more balanced with some bitter, citrus pith and leafy hop character, but still has lots of mango, passion fruit, tangerine, nectarine, along with grass and floral notes. A clean slightly sweet pale malt core, creamy oat character. Finish is bone dry and moderately bitter, with lingering fruit. Smooth and round in the mouth with a soft but still prickling carbonation. Really lovely balance here, the hop schedule is obviously nailed so its nice and juicy, but its balanced by a touch of bitterness and fleshed out by the mouthfeel. This is so drinkable!

0.33 bottle.   A very hazy, light honey color and a small, white head. A very strong aroma of citruses, pines, some grains, tropical fruits, and some dankness. Taste is hoppy, grainy, piney, grassy, somewhat juicy; generally a good mix between sweet and sour. A full body, an oily texture, and an average carbonation. Finish is medium long, sweeter, very juicy, very pleasant. Overall the beer is not particularly complex but insanely tasty.

ENORMOUS THANKS VIKTOR! Shared with Ogivlado, Franski and Kajser. Murky yellow body, small but lasting white head. Enormous tropical fruit, lime and hugely dank aroma. Tropical fruit, huge grapefruit, dankness, medium well integrated piney notes. Lightly prickly carbonation to round everything well up, not overly bitter, just well rounded, maybe a bit light in the taste, but only a little. Superbly aromatic, complexly hoppy, well balanced IPA. Wow.

Finally I could track this one down on tap in Copenhagen! Draught at Black Swan Bar. Milky golden colour with a creamy, white head. Finishes lasting dry and bitter with lingering citrus fruits and exotic impressions. World class IPA, well worth the hype!

thanks to Rob for this treat

hazy pineapple color. Bright white head that falls to a thin collar, some spotty lacing.

taste is pineapple. Heaps of pineapple. Fresh and overripe. Dank and not dank. A little astringent in the back but very well done. Pretty spot on for NE IPA style.

330ml bottle from Kihoskh. Batch 549, BBE 090517. Pours cloudy yellowish with a smooth foamy head. Aroma of juicy and citrusy hops, grapefruit, truckload of tropical fruits, mild dankness and grass. Very tasty and balanced NE style IPA, despite its not super fresh.

Bottle @ home. So it really lives up to the hype with an astonishing punch of fruity hops, intensive in aroma and taste but perfectly balanced with no cloying hop resins. Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma of tangerine, pine apple, orange, sweet mango, fresh pine and white bread . Body is medium with a really smooth palate. Taste is tangerine sweet with low and balanced bitterness. Flavors of pine apple, oranges, mango, apricots, pine, flesh baked bread. Finish has some increased grapefruit bitterness, more tangerine and lingering pine Apple.

Bottle from We Brought Beer. Muddy pale straw with nice creamy head and lacing. Dank vegetal aroma, bruised tropics. Strong bitterness and spice. Tight carbonation. Fantastic stuff and up there with the best Kernel IPAs.
impressions of peach, mango, pineapple, pine. balanced fruit and hop profile, juicy, which i like, nice slightly bitter aftertaste.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy yellow colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, citrus and pine needles.
Fruity flavor of hops and citrus with notes of pine needles.
Hoppy finish.

Oklar, ljust citron gul, vitt skum. Doft: Söt fruktkola, humle, grape, omogen exotisk frukt. Lite svag doft men jag är lite förkyld. Smak: Som doft i stort med betoning på fruktkola + Fanta och mango.

Pours hazy to murky yellow with low white head. Aroma of pine, lactose, lime, citrus, passion fruit, mild pineapple. Taste is smooth very mild bitter up front followed by a slightly funky sweet and then a light lingering bitter finish. Reminds me a bit of Hill Farmstead Susan. Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours cloudy gold/yellow with a white head. Smells like tropical juice, citrus notes, with a malt backbone. Balanced bitterness, alot of tropic fruit. This is a great beer!

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Bottle from Bottle Baron. Milky pale golden body with a medium white head that holds well. Lively carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of crackers, apricot, piña colada and melon rind. Flavour of mango, white bread, underripe pineapple and creamy sweetness, cleansed by a bitter, limey finish. Medium body with a smooth, oily texture. Soft fizz. An impressive IPA, although I feel that Amazing Haze is better.

Bottle. Aroma of plenty pineapple, orange, fresh mango, slightly grassy, hints of dankness. 
Pours sparkling yellow - like pineapple juice - with a tight white head. 
Taste follows the nose with loads of tropical fruitiness, lower bitterness and a nice fruity sweetness. 
Medium plus body, silky mouthfeel, soft carbonation, lightly grassy finish. 
Awesome IPA to say the least.

Tap at Dunkbar. Cloudy golden with white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, especially mango and passion fruit. Taste of grapefruit and fresh hops, very bitter and greasy. keeps to the bitter end.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 (33 cl bottle from Kihoskh; Batch #567; BBD: 19.06.2017) So assuming Stigberget marks their IPAs with BBD six months after production this one would have been bottled on December 19th making it 11 days old upon imbibement. This one was poured in a (rinsed) Rochefort goblet at fridge temperature revealing a cloudy golden body with just one finger of white head that recedes leaving film and beautiful lace. I actually had this one on tap at Himmeriget just yesterday when I had the chance to compare it side by side with Alefarm Fir. I recognise here the relatively sharp citrus / grapefruit juice note that cuts through the hopforward juicy NE IPA aroma. Perhaps there is a bit of onion / sweat in there too. Quite crisp on the palate, light body, soft carbonation and a crisp and somewhat tart finish that makes you think of lactic acid perhaps. I dont know how old the Fermentoren batch was when I had it but it seemed a bit more fruity aromawise.
Original rating from November 16th 2016 (A: 8; Ap: 4; Fl: 8; Pa: 4; O: 16) 
(on tap @ Fermentoren) Poured at fridge temperature into a shaker reveals a cloudy golden body with one finger of white head. Good retention and beautiful lace. Aroma is beautifully hopforward with notes of tropical fruit juice as well as hints of peach, mango and onion. Oily texture, medium body, soft carbonation and a lingering, pleasantly aromatic finish. Flavour has plenty of aroma notes and par for the style of New England IPA the bitterness remains subdued in favour of drinkability. This is a very successful implementation of my favourite beer style and I can only hope that Stigberget manages to continue producing beer like this regardless of whatever contractual arrangements may be in place. Ill definitely be looking out for the Amazing Haze as well!

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Pours a pretty milky yellow with a small white head that settles to a thin film. The nose isnt very potent but the smell is very very enjoyable with big tropical fruits, juicy mango most of all and very soft whiffs of flowery yeast. The taste is mildly hoppy with soft sweet fruits and a lightly bitter juicy finish and a slightly bitter, yet still fruity, aftertaste. The mouthfeel is fairly light and everything is highly quaffable. 
Tried this fresh on tap and felt it needed an extra point.

Grumlig ananas juice:ig färg och benvitkrona! Doft av tropisk fruktkött, fantastisk tropik Juice:ig smak med rejäl beska! Det här var grejer! Fin besk eftersmak

The aroma is full of hops, pineapple, mango, papaya, peaches and passionfruit. The color is reminiscent of orange juice. The taste is full of hops, peaches, oranges, pineapple, mango, papaya, lychees, guava, orange peel and jucie. What an amazing beer, no wonder this is the most hyped beer in Europe right now. This is a juice bomb! This is also the closest we get to the Treehouse and Trillium stuff in Europe, although I have never tasted beers from those breweries but so I have heard. Stigbergets is killing it at the moment. A shame they would not brew any more of this amazing beer. The only bad thing about this beer is that it slightly bitter on the palate and the finish but other than that, its freaking amazing!
From growler. Pours hazy yellow to orange. Aroma is crisp hoppy. Peachy and grapefruity. Smooth fruity. Bitter and smooth fruity. Crisp hoppy finish.
Cloudy pale yellow. Aroma has fresh, juicy citrus, lemon and peach, light peppery notes. Juicy, malty, sweet and bitter citrus peel. Lasting, bitter citrus peel finish. Good. Thanks Orla!

On tap at Dunkbar. Muddy yellow with a lasting white head. Big fruity hop aroma, with grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, mango, along with a touch of pine. Sweet hoppy flavour, with juicy modern character, along with some pine and grapefruit old school character, and a really nice balancing bitterness.
Tap @ dunkbar. Hazy yellow body with a small white head. Hops, tropical fruit, pineapple, mango, tropical juice, slight spices. Very drinkable. Nice glass of bams.

Pours yellow and very hazy, lot of sediment in the bottom of the bottle. Aroma is tropical fruits with hints of berries.

Taste follows the aroma with an extremely well done bedding of malts, very soft and easy drinking beer. 
To me it is the balance of the beer that makes it one of the best ones i ever had, right amount of aroma and flavor without becoming unpleasant to drink.

Bottle from SB, Batch 537.

Pours a very hazy mellow yellow, with a small white head. 
Aroma of slight grass, plenty of floral, slight spice, pine, hop juice, pineapple. NE hop juice has come to Sweden. Or maybe Swedish hops has come to NE? 
Taste is rather bitter, but sure is drinkable and enjoyable. 
Medium bodied, with a crisp carbonation. Very well made.
Bottle. Completely cloudy yellow pour with white head. Aroma has apricot and pineapple. Very tropical and fresh. Taste is fresh and has a good bitter kick. Quite light body. Fresh and potent.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2016 Re-rates in bottle, actually better than when on tap at Himmeriget. Hazy golden yellow. Lovely herbal aroma, I would guess some Mosaic, maybe Citra hops. Very much a East Coast/New England style IPA, not a West Coast hop bomb. Maybe even too well-balanced, but delicious. Worth the hype? I would still choose a SD IPA or a Blind Pig, but it is definitely really good, no flaws whatsoever.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of malt, light caramel loads of fresh fruity hops, grass, peach, melon, citrus, light piney. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, malt, grass, loads of fruity hops, citrus, light pine. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. Very drinkable. 291016

Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 281016
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is murky golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, fruits, flowers, malt, pine, grass and has a nice bitter light grassy finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus, 6.5%. Unclear yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, tropical fruit, citrus, little pineapple and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit, little sweet, little dry, little pineapple, fruit peel and medium bitter.

Draft. An unclear yellow beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of petroleum, hops, lemons, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, lemons, and petroleum, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle, july 24th 2016. Hazy golden body, medium white head. Aroma is piney with lots of tropical hops, dank hoppy taste with mild sweet malt notes, explodes with a fruity and bitter finish. Quite nice and very well balanced.

WoW. What a refreshing and tasty beer. Smooth and balanced in every way. One more please.Cloudy yellow golden color with a fine thick white head. Nice lacing. Looks inviting and nice. Good intensity in the aroma. Medium body and a smooth fine carbonation level. Easy to drink. Semi dry texture and a fine fresh bitterness. Citric, pine, biscuit and fruity flavor.[On tap at Haket in Gothenburg, Sweden]IPA #600

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2016 Pours juicy orange with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of mango, peach, pineapple, apricot, resin, grass and pine cones. Taste is ridiculously fruity with a nice bitterness that is not too aggressive.  Mouthfeel is juicy with medium body and carbonation.  Great stuff!

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Bottled. Pours pale golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, grapefruit, peach and herbal notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being dry and bitter. Medium bodied,oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent IPA. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Bottle at the tasting. From Echobeer through Todd. Thanks!

A:Very cloudy yellow, thin white head.

N: Lots of grapefruit, pine, earth, pineapple, apricot, and cracker. Pretty big IPA. 

T: Quite bitter and fairly citrusy. 

M: Some alcohol, medium resinous body, crisp carbonation.

O: Enjoyable IPA. Not the best one Ive ever had, but it holds its own.

It pours hazy yellow with a white head. The aroma has pineapple, mango, tangerine and rich malt. It has a medium rich body with soft carbonation. The taste is like the aroma and very rich and has more grapefruit and zest. Thanks again to hannont.
Thanks to PMgep (Stefan)... Orange beer, medium head. Aroma is citrus, hops, tropical fruit, mango. Taste is citrus, bitter dry, long aftertaste, nice one.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a cloudy golden with a lacing, white head. Very dank aroma, herbal and even buttery. Medium body, very soft on the palate, very fruity, more herbal than citrusy and tropical. Bitter and somewhat rough finish. Batch 491 - best before is hard to read. 220816
How: bottle Appearance: cloudy yellow, small white head. Aroma: tropical fruits, lemon, herbs, pine, apples and floral. Palate: medium body, medium carbonation.

Bottle. 6.5%. Best before 16.12.21. Pours a hazy yellow, with a white head. Good lacing. Aroma is mango and citrus; a bit generic at first, but develops into grape fruit and orange as it warms. Flavour is mango and citrus as well, with a malty note in the background. Light wheat note as it warms. Bitter finish, a bit tart. Orange peel note, grainy hint and a light alcohol burn/note. Lingering dryness and a note of grass. Overall good. Not complex, but clean and well-balanced aroma. Flavour is a bit less well-balanced, especially in the finish, but still good. 17.08.16.

Bottle shared by linus, poured hazy deep golden with achoe head on top. Nose of floral hops, light caramel malts, tropical fruits, mango, fresh stone fruits, crisp biscuit malts, citrus, and light pine notes. Taste is soft and very fruity, light resinous pine finish. Perfect hop bitter aftertaste. These guys have impressed me. Amazing ipa. Even when its not that fresh anymore

Sample from bottle, shared with X random people in the Cantillon Blåbær 2016 line in Copenhagen. :-) Pours a hazy yellow body with a creamy white head. Aroma is floral fruity hops, light minty herbal tones, pineapple, papaya and hints of pale malts, grass and red fruits. Taste is red fruits, pineapple, wet grass, minty herbs and hints of pale malts, papaya and floral heathery notes. Light body, medium carbonation. Nice enough IPA, but I really struggle to get the "New England IPA" hype. Same with Heady Topper. The style is decent, but I fail to perceive the grandeur people pile upon it. A decent West Coast IPA makes my day any day over this style. So no biggie really.

27th July 2016Level 42 bottleshare. Thanks to Alex. Light haze on this yellowish gold beer, tidy pale cream colour head. Palate is light and mildly dry. Decent.fine carbonation. Light malts, nice light creamy sweetness. Good hops - pine, mild skunk, modest hop spice and well integrated tropical fruits, mildly ripe. Spicy pine finish. Richly flavoured but light on its toes. Very nice.

25cl bottle. Thanks to Hackobock. Pours hazy to muddy yellow (been standing for days) with a small white head. Juicy and exotic nose and flavor with a touch of yeast. Peppery dry juicy bitterness. Nice one

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2016 Bottle thanks to Chris (ajsiem)! Pours opaque golden yellow with a large white head which soon dissipates. Taste is citrus sweet, pine, grapefruit tart, resin. Solid well-rounded IPA!

Tasting @ fillepolo 20160804. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity, hoppy, citrusy, grapefruity, tropical fruity, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter, fruity and hoppy. A fantastic IPA.
Bottle from systembolaget @ fillepolos place. Pours a light golden colour beer with a small head. Fruity and hoppy with grape and pineapple. Well balanced and very pleasent to drink. Dry finish

66cl bottle shared at the 42nd Floor. Many thanks to Alex for this one. It pours a hazed pale straw color with a small white head. Aroma is tangy and danky with plenty notes of lemon peel, weed, grass, pine cones, grapefruit, light inion and melon. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, excellent

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2016 Bottle Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of pineapple, dank hops, elderflower, orange, peach, mandarin, orange ice-cream and very dank overall. The taste is dank with that low-bitterness juiciness. Pineapple, orange ice-cream, slight pine, herbs and a pretty bitter end. Extremely good!

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares Reunion tasting / Reset #1. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aromas of pineapple, herbal, citrussy, elderflower, peach. Taste is herbal, pineapple, lemon, bitter, peachy, floral. Delicious!

Bottle at the Dangerous Bottleshares Reunion/season premiere. Pours a hazy yellow with a creamy white head. Aroma has floral, fruity hops, light minty, slightly unripe pineapple, fruit sorbet, orange, tangerine. Taste is rather sweet, light minty freshness, floral, leading to a medium bitter finish. Average carbonation and a smooth body.

Bottle at a tasting. Lemony citrusy zesty slightly sourish hops aroma and flavour. Fresh and juicy, but somewhat overwhelming with its overlap into lemony sourness - impairing drinkability. Still quite good though.

Bottle kindly shared by Gurthnar, many thanks. Hazy pale yellow golden color with huge white head. Aroma of oranges, tangerines, zest, pines. Nice citrus hoppy taste with zest, oranges, pines. Solid malty backbone. Long hoppy bitter finish. Very good.
Bottle from Gurthnar. Pale cloudy color, medium white head. Aroma is freshy, citrusy, zesty, piney, tangerines Taste is solid hoppy, decent bitterness, zesty, piney, citrusy, tangerines, nice
Bottle shared by Gurthnar, many many thanks. Pours hazy yellow color, white head. Aroma of peach, orange, lemon, grapefruit. Taste is bitter, medium sweet, orange, tangerines, peach, hoppy, pellets.
Trübes dunkel orange goldenes Bier mit einer großen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch grasig frisch hopfig, grapefruit. Geschmack trocken bitter hopfig, grapefruit, citrusfrüchte, lecker!

Gyllene gul och disig. Härlig fruktig doft med drag åt citrus. Mycket god och balanserad

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared in the Ølbutikken Blåbær release queue - (thanks to Ronny) golden fuzzy pour with white head. Aroma and taste showcases a plethora of tropical and citrus juicy fruits with resonating notes of grapefruit, tangerine, mango, lemon, some bready malts, fresh juicy and hoppy bitter into the close. Gorgeous.

A packed IPA. Strong Aroma of Tropical fruites that comes back in the taste. You end up with a long and pleasent aftertaste. Stigbegerts have done something really well here, I hope they can produce more great beers

Bottle in Blåbærkø. Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Very bitter with a mellow sweetness. Loads of sprucey hops aromas with some citrus fruits. Also hints of resin. Very fresh. Medium to full bodied with a slightly oily palate. Medium carbonation. Long bitter finish.
Bottle que at blåbær. Pours cloudy orange with a white head. Aroma of mosaic, thistle, peach, grape good citrus, dank. Taste is rather bitter loads juicy hops, peach and mango. Fresh

Bottle shared on Level 42 27/07/2016. Many thanks to Alex via Leighton. A hazed golden yellow coloured pour with a a lose white head. Aroma is nice dank citrus hop, petrol, bready malts. Flavour is composed of raw grains, juicy citrus hops, mango and dank citrus, spicy citrus. Palate is grainy, frothy carbonation, rounded. Really good shit

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 Bottle in Blåbær queue, thanks Swedish stranger. Hazy yellow, medium sized white head. Lots of fresh tropical fruits: peach, apricot, citrus, mango, pineapple. Light biscuit. Medium body, mild sweet, assertive bitterness, mild fatness and acidity. Deserves the high rating.

Some burnt plastic, pineapple, grapefruit, lemon zest, sweet bread, alcohol.
Hazy golden colour, big white head, lacing.
Big bite, mid-sweet, lots of fresh pineapple and grapefruit in the taste.
Medium body, fizzy carbonation, long bitter finish.
Solid.
Pale yellow, hazy, full head at first. Aroma of citrus, pine, mango. Tropical fruits also in the taste. Distinct but balanced bitternes towards the malt.

Many thanks to Nisse666 for this bottle! Very intense fresh floral nose. The beer starts extreme intense floral. Light in body, not too sweetish. The hops are in the foreground, fresh and fruity, resin, nice sticky pine. Very sessionable with lots of depth. Long sticky intense fruity piney aftertaste with a body in the background and a nice intense mild hopping!

Bottle at Beermongers (tasting). Pours a clear golden orange color with a medium white head. A big fresh citrus nose, lots of tropical notes. Low bitterness, lots of oily sweet citrus, late boil goodness, a bit of earthy biscuit malt. Clean and flavorful.

Bottle share at One Canada Square. Many thanks to Alex. As Stigbergets GBG Beer Week 2016, 6.5%, BB Jan 2017. Dark golden yellow, opaque, hazy, small foamy white head leaves thick lacing. Aroma is dank and oniony, pineapple mango, very tropical. Smells great. Body is smooth and rounded with tingly carbonation. Taste is smooth malt, tropical hops, mixed fruits, mango, light rubbery dimension, smooth finish with some resinous floral notes. A very good IPA. For the ABV, its great.

Bottle thanks to Alex. It pours hazy yellow - gold with a medium white head. The aroma is fresh, juicy, passion fruit, nectarine, pine colada, stra, white pepper, grassy, dank and cracker. The taste is crisp, bitter, grassy, some dankness, tropical fruits, grapefruit, nectarine, peppery spice, pineapple, straw and a touch of alcohol with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Fresh and refreshing. Very tasty stuff.

Bottle at Level 42, thanks to Alex, via LKS, 27/07/16.
Hazed golden blonde with a decent off white covering.
Nose is apricot jam, light pine, tangerine, pithy citrics, soft bread, light pine, sweet ladies armpit on a hot day.
Taste comprises skunky danko hops, grapefruit, pineapple chunks, light pine, melon, soft bread.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with lightly skunked hop bitterness.
Solid IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared in London - huge thanks to Alex for this one! Pours hazy yellow-gold with a frothy, white head. Nice dank aroma, fresh citrus, melon, papaya, light pine. Medium sweet flavour with super juicy citrus, a little piss, mango, papaya, lemon rind, undertones of pale bread. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Lightly resinous on the finish, dank and juicy, with further pale bread, more melon, papaya, light honey, pale bread, soft piney bitterness. Outstanding.
Lots of exotic fruits in both aroma and taste. Great body for the alcohol percentage. Nice bitterness and juiciness. Slightly stiff towards the end. Very close to perfection.
Pure hop juice! Citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruits. Great mouthfeel and a lovely bitter aftertaste. The best IPA Ive had and its from my hometown!!!

Pale yellow color, hazy, large white head. Fresh hop aromas, citrus and pine needles, floral, like Swedish spring. Crisp, fresh taste of pine tree bark and grapefruit juice. Dry mouthfeel, perfectly balanced bitter/sweet finish. Best IPA to date.
Bottle generously shared by Randall. Yellow pour with a white head. Minerally hop bouquet. Taste follows suit with grassy/resin highlights. Really good body and mouthfeel. Impressive.
Bottle - pours hazy yellow. Nose is garlic, onion, lemon zest, grapefruit. Taste is oranges, lemon, grapefruit, tangerines.

330 mL bottle. Hazy pale orange. Smells very nice. Tropical fruits, citrus, light garlic bite. Tastes of orange and grapefruit. Tropical fruit sweetness and a light grain flavor. Moderate hop bitterness. Medium light body. Drinkable with a delicious hop flavor.
Bottle @ home, from Systembolaget. Cloudy golden pour with a decent head. Tons of tropical fruits here, light dank, mangoes, grapefruit, stone fruits, sweet and a pleasant light bitterness.

Bottle thanks to nisse666. Cloudy yellow with little white head. Aroma is lychee, tropic fruit, a little white bread. Taste is light fresh sourness, a tiny hint of bitterness, more fruity stuff. In the finish we have a little bit of pine cone. Pleasant mouthfeel, medium carbonated. Very nice.

Fresh bottle from my Eurosanta Nisse666, many thanks! Hazy yellow-orangr color with white head. Aroma is pineapple, mango, passion fruit, lychee, but not aggressive, very nicely interwoven with some yeasty notes, some sweatsocks (probably Mosaic) as well. Taste is more balanced fruit and sweatsocks, medium carbonation, lightly tart medium bittersweet finish. A beauty.
Bottle. Catty citrus, lychee, onions. Murky yellow, grey lace. Sparkly, light minerally, broad grassy, herbal, tropics retronasal. Medium light body, sweaty herbal hop aftertaste

(bottle, many thanks to nisse666!) hazy pale golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of sweatsocks and pretzel sticks, heavily resinous, with a light touch of custard, some yeast and banana skins. flavour is mostly the same, more resin, cactus juice and herbal hops, slightly sweet, with some light notes of gooseberries, some teriyaki sauce and a medium-bitter finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2016 July 8-25, 2016. Bottles and on tap. 
Hazy yellow with a medium sized white head sticking to the glass and leaving some nice lacing. Aroma is very fruity and dank with mango, pineapple, papaya, grapefruit, orange, grape skins, notes of grass, pine, some herbal notes  and biscuit.
Taste is light sweet, fruity, light to medium smooth bitterness. Finish is light sweet with biscuit, ripe mango, pineapple and papaya, smooth medium bitterness with grass, pin, grapefruit and weed. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Amazing, fruity and smooth local IPA, finally!

A perfect scent of tropical fruits. The taste is the same. As a mouth orgasm. Perfectly balanced taste between bitter and sweet. Celestial good bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Perfection in a bottle. Had high expectations and I was not displeased. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle from Systembolaget. 

Hazy yellow with a large white head. Fresh and hoppy with grapefruit, passionfruit, mango and light malt. Also hints of something that reminded of cucumber. Kind of juicy and easy to drink with a medium bitter finish. Tasty.
UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016 Flaska beställd från SB. Dimmigt gul med vitt skum. Frisk doft av citrus och passionfrukt. Lätt och fruktig med liten sötma och balanserad beska.
@ Basunen 16-7-23: Em mycket god doft och smak. Fräsch, humlerik, avbalanserade toner av mango, apelsin, gräs och syra. Det bästa Sverige har att bjuda på just nu.

The beer is unclear and is in a lovely yellow color.
The foam is white with small to medium bubbles will in just the right amount.
The foam disappears at a good pace and leaves very fine grooves.
Was a bit of a foam explosion in the beginning so you had to pour gently.
Even when I opened the cap came aromas of pineapple and tropical fruits.
Now theyve got the beer in the glass and smells really bursting forward.
Aromas of hops, pineapple, grapefruit, some mangoes, and back a little apricot.
Small notes of lime and some pine needles.
The taste is fruity with intense tropical hops.
The fruits that meet a mango, pineapple, grapefruit, apricot in a balanced mix.
The beer is moderately bitter, but also with a little sweetness and pine needles.
The beer has a moderate-balanced hop character that does not take over.
Medium body, with some sweetness.
Moderate bitterness, with a soft touch.
Occasionally with carbonic acid.

Bottle. Hazy yellow, big massive head, dissipates slowly leaving lots of lacings. Aroma is an epitome of fresh hops, very grapefruitish and passion fruitish, orange and lemon. Taste is very hoppish, loads of floral and fruity hops and a perfectly executed malty ground to balance it all, medium to high bitterness, very round and juicy feel. This is world class.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Cloudy straw colour, rich firm head. Pungent aroma of passionfruit and pink grapefruit. Mid sweet with medium body and gentle, well rounded mouthfeel. Perfumy passionfruit, citrus and mango dominates this beer totally. The gently soft malt profile improves drinkability and enhances the experience. Mid bitter finish. One of the best IPAs Ive had.

Bottle:Hazy pale orange with a large head.Fruity aroma with notes of citrus peels, nettles and goose berries.Big, fruity bitterness with los of orange peels, hops, pine needles, lime, resin and goose berries.Goes down very, very easy!

Aroma is pure, sweet and ripe tropical fruits. Peaches, mangos and sweet pineapples. A slight hint of cake dough and a small sting of lime peels. Taste is just as I suspected, a sweet tropical juice beer, but it also carries a small amount of bitterness to balance out the pure sweetness. Very careful bitter notes from orange peels marries with this pure hop juice and leaves you longing for more.
Flaska. Mycket inbjudande dofter av passionsfrukt, ananas och blomster. Smakinslag av passionsfrukt, blomster, grapefrukt och tallbarr. Aningen stickig beska, Medelkropp.

Bottle.
Pours hazy yellow with a big frothy head.
Lots of ripe tropical fruit, very smooth aroma.
Taste is pretty much the same, loads of tropical fruit followed by resin and bitterness. 
Medium body, soft carbonation, super smooth and creamy mouth feel.
Smooth, bitter after taste with some "green" hop taste.
Could benefit from more carbonation. Still, very good and balanced as the bitterness doesnt take over at all.

Bottle from systembolaget. 
Pours hazy yellow with a bubbly head. 
Aroma of peaches, passion fruit and pineapple. 
Very balanced sweetness with lots of grapefruit, lime zest, and a little pine.

Bottle.
Hazy, yellow. White head 
Aroma of citra, citrus. Gras
Taste sweet bitterness, fizzy round taste.
Quite good.

Hazy yellow with a thick white head. Aroma of passionfruit, grapes, overripe apricot and mango. Mellow taste with a punch of apricot and mango in the end, very nice and clean, cloudy mouthfeel, and close to perfect bitterness. The best example of a NEIPA in Sweden so far.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a big white head. Notes of lime, pineapple and grapefruit in aroma. Taste is intensivley hoppy but also a bit sweet. Everything is in great balance. Notes of lime, mango, pineapple and birch. Moderate bitterness. Soft and grainy mouthfeel that reminds me of Heady Topper.

Flaska från SB. Någonstans mellan gul och orange, djupt disig vätska med vitt skum mestadels lägger sig. Fyllig, juice:ig doft med mängder av ananas, mango och apelsin. Hela det tropiska paketet är där. En bitter ton finns med som stör en aning och håller tillbaka den riktigt härliga tropiska juicen, lite svårplacerad. Även något jästiga inslag, och en grapebeska går att ana. Stor, fyllig kropp som går över i en något lättare, torr avslutning. Fruktigt, juice:igt läskande och törstsläckande. Mango, ananas, passion, ctirus. Backas upp av en beska som ligger som en "smak"-matta i bakgrunden. Sett fram emot att testa utifrån de hittills väldigt positiva recensionerna. Inte helt övertygad - gott är det, men har druckit bättre inom samma stil. Har en flaska till i kylen, kanske lyckas övertyga mig nästa försök.
Cloudy Yellow. Really hoppy, lots of pinapple and mango in the nose and the taste. Reallt good IPA with medium body and nice aftertaste.

Draught at Haket, Göteborg, on July 16, 2016.Had this with the first release, but was in non-rating mode. Cans ort of remember liking the first one better.Cloudy straw yellow to pale golden color, white to off-whtie head with lacing. Malty, sweet, caramel, hoppy, citrus, resin taste. Hoppy, citrus aftertaste. Full mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Hoppy, citrus, a bit malty scent.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2016 330ml bottle. Hazy yellow with two finger white head. Incredibly juicy aroma with pineapple, mango, passion fruit, citrus and general tropical fruitiness with a certain dank undertone. Taste is equally juicy with a nice bitterness to it and with the same tropical fruit, pineapple, mango, passion fruit, citrus etc. and the addition of soft grapefruit and pine as well as the same dank undertone as in the aroma. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation and soft piney aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2016 Bottle from SB. Best by 161227.
Cloudy bright yellow, medium moussey head, some shattered lacings.
Aroma is bright tropical with hops, pineapple, lime, oranges, wheat and zest.
Taste follows suite with soft slim soft wheaty malts, bright citrus like mandarines and oranges with some pineapple and a medium bitter zesty hoppy finish. A pinch of of sweetness in the beginning, finishes bitter and dry.
Medium body, soft spritzy carbonation, soft to dry texture.
Very good. Maybe its rumour gave higher expectations, but they are really starting to compete with other swedish trendy brewers such as Omnipollo and Brewski.

Bottle from SB 160716.
Pours a very cloudy and sediment rich light orange yellow with a lasting, creamy, lacing white head. 
My, what a nice IPA. Tons of tropical fruits and resin from every kind pine, especially fir tree. One of the best IPAs I've had for ages.

Aromas hoppy of citrusy fruits, lemon zest, pine, caramel, hints of green tea 
Taste has hoppy notes of citrusy fruits, passion fruit, pineapples, green tea, grass, pine, caramel 
Mouthfeel is medium carbonation, crisp, low to medium bitterness

Flaska från SB. Apelsingul vätska med vitt skum. Doft av ananas, citrus, mangomos, persika. Väldigt tropiskt. I smak är det mandarin, ananas, grape och det vita i apelsinen. Mediumsötma, lagom beskt. Rätt tjock kropp, skön munkänsla med eftersmak som vilar mjukt i munnen efteråt.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Nice grassy aroma. Hazy yellow colour. Nice hoppy taste. One of the best Swedish IPA Ive had.
Bottle. Hazy yellow liquid with a medium white head. Heavy notes of tropical fruits in the aroma, loads of pineapple and passionfruit. Taste is pretty much the same with a fresh and bitter finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy, straw coloured pour. Fruit packed aroma, pineapple, citrus, nectarines. 
Soft mouthfeel, low to medium bitterness. Tasty. Great beer.
330ml bottle. Cloudy yellow body with a medium white head. Sweet tropical fruits and dough hits the nose, followed by a similar taste along with a hunt of resin.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2016 Flaska från SB i Djurås. En mycket färsk doft med citrus, barr, ananas och blött gräs. I smak känns mandarin, pommerans, barr, ananas och lite grape. Bra tryck i humlen utan att på något sätt bli för tung. Förbaskat välbalanserad ipa. Fräsch, pigg och bra riv i efterbeskan

330ml bottle.
Pours a cloudy deep straw, with a white head.
Hoppy, piney, resiny aroma, grapefruit, grass, apricot, passion fruit.
Off-dry, medium body, mid to high bitterness, balanced CO2.
